reviews.text: This is a place to make you feel happy and relaxed, just what you need during a sightseeing and adventure holiday! We felt welcome from the moment we arrived. Our family occupied two large garden suites. Both were impeccably clean and tastefully decorated with wooden furniture. I especially appreciated the small wooden desk in front of the window. The bathrooms had all you could want, including a great shower and nice toiletteries. Wifi was included in the price and worked seamlessly. There was mosquito netting over the bed and a mosquito screen in front of the door. Moreover, the staff lit anti-mosquito coils outside every night!
reviews.title: Peaceful, lush and traditional style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the only place we have ever stayed where the minibar is reasonably priced, which added to our impression that we were welcome guests.
reviews.title: Intimate And Stylish

reviews.text: The way the suites are laid out everybody enjoys maximum privacy, with strategically placed plants between private entrances and a beautiful swimming pool.
reviews.title: Paradise close to the city

reviews.text: As mentioned by others, this is a bed and breakfast. If you have requests or questions, it is best to sort things out in the morning. However, thanks to wifi and an additional internet connected computer room in the main house, you can easily organise yourself without help.
reviews.title: No change, perfect stay again

reviews.text: The Baan Orapin is not in the Center but within walking distance if you don't mind jumping out of the way of the diverse street users in this part of town. We enjoyed our walks in the mornings - across the foot bridge and through the day market - and our tuktuk rides at night, and were glad not to stay in the unattractive big hotels of the busy center.
reviews.title: just what the doctor would order

reviews.text: Every time I unlocked the door in the gate at Baan Orapin and stepped into their delightfully landscaped tranquil grounds it was as if I’d come home. Baan Orapin is a peaceful refuge from the busy streets of Chaing Mai. Baan Orapin’s location is the best of both worlds – close enough to easily walk to and explore Chaing Mai’s historical sites, but from its site east of the river just far enough away from the bustle of Chaing Mai to be an oasis.
reviews.title: The only place we’ll stay in Chaing Mai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We’ve stayed here twice – in June and March 2011 – both times in a Rear Wing Junior Suite. The suites are beautifully decorated; the bathrooms spacious and modern. The junior suite gave us plenty of space as opposed to some lodgings where a suite label means instant claustrophobia. Not only are the suites generous in size, but the space is well laid out with patio (or balcony) plus living area as you enter. I enjoyed the beauty of the room, my teenage son appreciated a mini-bar so reasonably priced that he remembered how many Thai Baht were required for a soda between our stays!
reviews.title: Generous breakfast options, Friendly Staff, Very Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is rare when both a parent and teenager are smitten with the same lodgings. As a parent of four, I can count the times that has occurred on one hand. Examples of why this hotel won both our hearts:
reviews.title: Business or pleasure. In any weather.

reviews.text: • The breakfasts were delicious and the fruit was the best of the trip. Each cup of coffee is individually made from freshly ground beans.
reviews.title: A Charming Oasis behind its own wall!!!

reviews.text: • Pepsi is an amazing ray of friendliness. Our son was pleased when Pepsi remembered him even though he’d grown inches and inches during the fourteen months between visits.
reviews.title: An Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can't go wrong with Baan Orapin: beautiful setting, tastefully decorated and spacious bungalows and friendly staff. The wi-fi works well, the breakfast is good (except the fresh fruit option didn't include mangos, as usual) and the garden with swimming pool, very relaxing.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The place is quiet (you can't hear the traffic). The traditional wooden house which hosts the reception and other facilities is worth a look...
reviews.title: Perfect oasis during a hot humid visit to Chiang Mai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Make sure you don't miss the pet rabbit hidden under a bush!
reviews.title: lovely guesthouse

reviews.text: Although not cheap, it was the best hotel we stayed at during our trip to Thailand.
reviews.title: Thai magic

reviews.text: Had 5 nights here and enjoyed our stay. We were in the rooms at the back of the guest house which were great. No noise from the road which might be a different experience in the front rooms. The room was comfortable and spacious. Good working aircon, free wifi and a very reasonably priced mini bar. Bathroom was big but my husband found it irritating there was no hot tap at the bathroom sink when he wanted to shave.
reviews.title: A Little Gem

reviews.text: Our stay at Baan Orapin was extremely enjoyable and relaxing. The B&B staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable, welcomed and valued. They helpfully gave local advice about markets, tuk-tuks and other useful information.
reviews.title: A hidden, restful oasis in this buzzing, fun city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great - quieter than staying directly in town; near to the artsy river district which is full of unique shops, riverside restaurants/bars, live music and art galleries. The Night Market was a 15 minute walk away or a 60 Baht tuk-tuk ride away. The sidewalks are not great in this part of the city which is a downside but other than that, I really loved this area!
reviews.title: All been said before

reviews.text: The B&B had elegant, charming, traditionally Thai-decorated rooms and lush gardens. Our Jr Suite was large, exceptionally clean with fresh flowers, a well-stocked reasonably priced ‘mini-bar’, good-sized frig, modern shower room with heaps of hot water, tv (not that we felt inclined to watch!), day/sofa bed, kettle (coffee, tea, water complementary) and a huge comfy bed.
reviews.title: A place to breathe and feel like you're in thailand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts were delicious and filling - a good choice of ‘sets’ including eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, fried rice, cereal, yogurt, fruit, traditional Thai breakfasts, coffee, tea, hot chocoate and more! Always served with a smile, near the pool veranda and beautiful Thai music playing in the background. The saltwater swimming pool is great - clean, the perfect size, with small waterfall and bubbles. Free WiFi in rooms and a PC with internet in the main building. Really cannot fault this place. Great service, old-world Thai charm, oozing with character, friendly helpful staff.
reviews.title: A charming place to stay in the heart of Chiangmai

reviews.text: Truly a quiet, hidden little oasis in this bustling, buzzing city.
reviews.title: Perfect perfect perfect
